intro: Eustephiopsis latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf stephania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
